title: Hanging, early 18th century
medium:
Medium: wool, linen
Technique: embroidered using long floating stitches and couching
description: Embroidered rectangular red wool hanging with a large central heraldic medallion and smaller medallions in each corner. Central medallion shows two angels, each in a blue robe, standing on ornate leaves of ivory and blue-green, holding an emblem enclosed by ornate leaves bearing on its outer edge with inscription: "Virtutis Bel-licae Praemium" in red on a dull yellow ground. The center contains a five-pointed ivory star above a yellow crescent on a blue ground. A jeweled crown tops the medallion and a yellow rosette pendant hangs on a ribbon at the bottom. The heraldic scene is enclosed by two crossed branches forming a circle. Corner medallions have a corner emblem encircled by elaborate leaves, topped by a jeweled crown and has a hanging rosette-pendant hanging from the bottom in the center of which is a sword through a crown on a red ground. The center of emblem has a symmetrical linear script-like device in ivory on a blue-green ground. The four corner emblems are connected by a wavy floral vine.

tombstone.epitaph:
Hanging, early 18th century. Medium: wool, linen
Technique: embroidered using long floating stitches and couching. 1969-129-1.
